item.title: Oil Rally Builds as Middle East Unrest Deepens: Markets Wrap
item.description: Oil climbed and stocks in Asia are set to follow a slump on Wall Street as concerns mount that an escalation of tensions in the Middle East could trigger a more direct US involvement.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

item.title: How China Is Building a Powerful Army of Hackers
item.description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China’s domestic hacking competitions are helping boost the country’s cyber-espionage capabilities.
item.dc:creator: K Oanh Ha, Naomi Ng, Yang Yang

item.title: Oil Extends Gains as Trump Spurs Middle East Escalation Concerns
item.description: Oil rose after jumping to the highest in almost five months on Tuesday, as President Donald Trump fueled speculation that the US is on the verge of joining Israel’s attack on Iran.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

item.title: Keyera to Buy Plains’ Canada NGL Business for $3.8 Billion
item.description: Keyera Corp. agreed to buy Plains All American Pipeline LP’s Canadian natural gas liquids business and some US assets for C$5.15 billion ($3.77 billion) in cash, significantly bulking up its pipeline system around the country.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

item.title: Trump Admin Weighs Crackdown on Pharma Ads | Bloomberg Markets 6/17/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Dartmouth College Professor: Economics David Blanchflower and Bloomberg's Rachel Cohrs Zhang. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Falls With Geopolitics in Focus Amid Israel-Iran Jitters
item.description: The S&P 500 declined on Tuesday as fears over a potential US involvement in the conflict between Israel and Iran caused traders to take risk off the table.
item.dc:creator: Joel Leon

media:content.media:description: Smoke rises after a reported strike on a building used by Islamic Republic of Iran News Network, part of Iran's state TV broadcaster, in Tehran, on June 16. Photographer: Getty Images/Getty Images

item.title: Activist Investors Flood Japanese Firms With Record Proposals
item.description: Activist investors are inundating Japanese companies with an unprecedented number of proposals that will keep executives on their toes at annual general meetings.
item.dc:creator: Momoka Yokoyama

media:content.media:description: Mount Fuji and the Shinjuku skyline in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, Feb. 14, 2025. Japan is scheduled to release its fourth-quarter gross domestic product (GDP) figures on Feb. 17.

item.title: Emerging Markets Slump as Mideast Risks Ramp Up Before Fed
item.description: Currencies and stocks in developing nations fell as escalating tensions in the Middle East and the upcoming Federal Reserve interest rate decision dimmed risk appetite.
item.dc:creator: Zijia Song, Srinivasan Sivabalan

media:content.media:description: Smoke billows from a site in the city of Haifa, Israel, on June 16.

item.title: Stocks Fall on Mideast War Escalation | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Traders Pile Into Bets That Next Fed Chair Will Slash US Rates
item.description: US rates traders have amassed a record futures bet that the Federal Reserve will take on a more dovish tilt right after Chair Jerome Powell’s term ends in May 2026.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

media:content.media:description: Television stations broadcast Jerome Powell, chairman of the US Federal Reserve, speaking after a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Federal Reserve officials held interest rates steady for a third-straight meeting and emphasized they see a growing risk of both higher inflation and rising unemployment.

item.title: Blistering Rally in Herbal Medicine Stock Mints $26 Billion Fortune
item.description: A blistering rally in a tiny, money-losing traditional Chinese medicine company’s stock has vaulted its founder’s net worth to among the world’s largest fortunes.
item.dc:creator: Dylan Sloan

item.title: EDPR to Shift Focus Within Asia to ‘High-Growth Markets’
item.description: EDP Renewables SA is shifting its focus within Asia-Pacific toward “high-growth markets” such as Japan, Australia and Taiwan, a spokesperson said in a statement.
item.dc:creator: Srinidhi Ragavendran, Sing Yee Ong

item.title: Ramp’s Valuation Jumps 20% in Latest Funding Round
item.description: Ramp CEO Eric Glyman talks about the company’s $200 million Series E funding round that values the company at $16 billion, and how the fintech company is adding AI to its expense tools. Glyman joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dartmouth's Blanchflower on Rate Cuts, US-UK Deal
item.description: Dartmouth College Professor: Economics David Blanchflower discusses whether the Fed will cut rates, discussess the meeting between President Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, and the US trade deal was a win for the UK. He speaks with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Applied Intuition's $15B Valuation for AI Vehicle Tech
item.description: Applied Intuition CEO Qasar Younis discusses how the company is developing models to make all moving machines self-driving. Younis speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Bonds Rise as Traders Bet on at Least One Fed Cut in 2025
item.description: Treasuries advanced as US economic data left intact expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates at least once in 2025.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Maki, Michael Mackenzie

media:content.media:description: The US Treasury building in Washington, DC.

item.title: Bozoma Saint John on the Value of Branding
item.description: Bozoma "Boz" Saint John, Former CMO at Netflix, Former Chief Brand Officer at Uber and Creator and CEO of Eve by Boz speaks Romaine Bostick about the importance of branding. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Admin Weighs Crackdown on Pharma Ads
item.description: The Trump administration is discussing policies that would make it harder and more expensive for pharmaceutical companies to advertise directly to patients, in a move that could disrupt more than $10 billion in annual ad spending. Bloomberg's Rachel Cohrs Zhang has more on the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Fall as Israel-Iran Jitters Spur Oil Rally: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street’s concerns that an escalation of tensions in the Middle East could trigger a more direct US involvement spurred a slide in stocks, which also dropped as weak economic data lifted bonds ahead of the Federal Reserve decision. Oil hit its highest since January.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump said Iran wants to talk about de-escalating the conflict with Israel. “They’d like to talk, but they should have done that before,” Trump said at the start of a meeting with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney at a Group of Seven leaders summit in Kananaskis, Alberta.

item.title: Scale AI’s Wang Joins Meta, Brings Deep Industry Connections
item.description: Bloomberg’s Ellen Huet discusses how Scale AI co-founder Alexandr Wang became so well connected within Silicon Valley, and what that offers Meta now that he is joining the social media company. Huet joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Making Lithium Batteries Without Rare Earths From China
item.description: Pure Lithium Chairman and CEO Emilie Bodoin discusses how the company is developing commercially viable lithium metal batteries that do not need critical metals sourced from China. Bodoin joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Revolut to Launch AI Financial Assistant: UK CEO
item.description: Francesca Carlesi, CEO for Revolut UK, told Bloomberg’s Francine Lacqua the company will be launching its AI financial assistant soon. Carlesi also discussed competition forcing convergence between new players and incumbent banks and regulation in a wide-ranging interview at a Bloomberg New Voices event in Milan. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Plays Down Iran-Israel Truce as He Leaves G-7 Early
item.description:
Donald Trump abruptly exited the G-7 summit in Canada, deepening questions about the US president’s promise to bring peace. Stephanie Lai explains.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Corporate Italy Lacks Female CEOs: Parzani
item.description: Claudia Parzani, Chair of Borsa Italiana, says the lack of female CEOs and chairs in Italy is a cultural issue that the business community needs to fix. She also discusses the need for tariff and regulatory clarity, simplifying the process for IPOs and a capital markets union with Bloomberg’s Francine Lacqua at a Bloomberg New Voices event in Milan. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Investing in the AI Buildout
item.description: Innovation in artificial intelligence is happening at the infrastructure level, but the buildout is still in the early stages, according to Lei Qiu, chief investment officer of Thematic Innovation Equities at AllianceBernstein. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: JFK AirTrain Cuts Fares 50% This Summer to Lure Riders Off Roads
item.description: The people mover that shuttles passengers to John F. Kennedy International Airport is cutting its fares by 50% this summer in a bid to reduce road traffic as construction peaks at the busiest New York City airport.
item.dc:creator: Aashna Shah

media:content.media:description: The AirTrain JFK is seen on it’s first day of service at John F. Kennedy International Airport in the Queens borough of New York on December 17, 2003.

item.title: Altcoins Resume Decline as Haven Appeal of Digital Assets Fades
item.description: Ether and Solana led declines in cryptocurrencies as concern about escalating conflict in the Middle East has investors moving away from risker assets.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

item.title: Oil Soars as Trump Raises Concerns of Escalating Middle East War
item.description: Oil jumped to the highest in almost five months as President Donald Trump fueled speculation that the US is on the verge of joining Israel’s attack on Iran, keeping the market on edge about potential crude supply disruptions in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fanzeres

item.title: Easterly High-Yield Muni Fund Plunges Nearly 50% in Sales Dump
item.description: Easterly Funds’ high-yield municipal-bond fund has dropped almost 50% since Friday as the portfolio unloaded illiquid securities from the riskiest part of the muni market, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Martin Z Braun

item.title: Tron Plans Crypto Treasury, Public Filing
item.description: Justin Sun, the China-born crypto entrepreneur with ties to the Trump family who saw a federal investigation of his business interests paused earlier this year, is set to take his Tron blockchain platform public in the US through a reverse merger. Bloomberg's Michael Regan has more on the story. (Source: Bloomberg)
